page.title: 11Old People's Day Centre
page.content: The centre takes a maximum of 50 people.The average amount of visitors a day is 30 to 40.Most of the people come 2-3 times a week.They go on day outings to places like Aylesford Priory.The elderly people travel to and from the centre by a minibus.There is also entertainment at the centre. They have bingo,raffles,brass bands and parties.They hold a clinic for foot care,and they have a hair salon.They have meals there too,hot and cold,and they have a tuck shop, which is a trolley which is taken around the centre and on it can be found sweets,tea,coffee and tinned food.The old people can buy what they want.The actual centre was built during the 1940s,but during the war it was used as a civil defence hall.
